problem.p: Suppose that a person is standing on a scale in an elevator when the elevator begins to accelerate upward. According to Newton's Third Law, one of the following forces will be equal and opposite to the force the person exerts on the scale (which is what the scale will read). Choose that force.

choice.name: foil1
choice.text: The normal force exerted on the person.

choice.name: foil2
choice.text: The person's mass times their acceleration.

choice.name: foil4
choice.text: None of the choices is the appropriate third law pair.

choice.name: foil5
choice.text: The force exerted on the scale by the elevator.
